bioghist.p: Incorporated in 1864, the Philadelphia and Erie Land Company laid out the town of Renovo, Pennsylvania, as the site for the great repair shops of the Philadelphia and Erie Division of the Pennsylvania Railroad. South Renovo, Pennsylvania, across the river from Renovo, was laid out in 1881.

scopecontent.p: This collection consists of records of the Philadelphia and Erie Land Company. Bound volumes include a dividend book (1866-1903), a record of the sale of town plots in Renovo, including sketches of the plots, and a book of unused stock certificates. Other materials include: maps, deeds, bond and warranties, reports and appraisals, mortgages, a record of capital distribution (1870-1903) and business correspondence. Most of the correspondence relates to the sale and development of land in Emporium and Renovo, and is directed to John A. Glenn, Secretary of the Company, and to Joseph F. Reilley, agent. The collection also includes a small number of business papers of the South Renovo Land Company.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
